content.description: Great route up steep limestone\dolomite on the northwestern side of the Cosmic Web wall. Technical climbing up beautiful rock.
content.protection: Quickdraws. No more than twelve needed. The route is six or seven bolts. There are chain anchors at the top. First bolt is a little high but with easy climbing to a nice stance where one clips the first bolt.
content.location: This is the rightmost line of bolts on the northwestern side of Cosmic Web wall.

content.description: Ok climbing up mostly solid rock. Big jug climbing 90% of the way followed up by a scary leftward traverse over suspect rock. Most people feel the crux is traversing over the rotten rock clipping the bolt in the middle of the traverse and then proceeding to the anchors with wrap rings. A couple of bolts do not become evident until you are right to them. The bolts are hard to spot from the bottom. You must have faith!!
content.protection: Quickdraws. Anchors at the top with wrap rings.
content.location: This route is the southern-most route on the west side of cosmic web wall. It shares the first two bolts with unknown right of chimney. There is a long runout over easy terrain between the 2nd and 3rd bolt. One may be able to slip a piece of gear between these two bolts if desired. The climbing is pretty easy however.

content.description: Good climbing with a variety of techniques and cool holds. Starts out easy past three or four bolts. Steepens as one nears the wide crack/chimney. A couple chimney moves up and then good face holds once again abound. Pretty steep near the end up to a  chain anchor. Crux is probably right before the chains after the last move or possibly as you get near the chimney near the middle of the route.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Very well protected climbing. Anchors at the top with wrap rings.
content.location: On the westish side of cosmic web wall. This route starts to the right of the chimney, climbs closer and eventually into the chimney as one gets near the middle of the climb. A couple of chimney moves and then back onto the face.

climbs.name: Cosmic Web
climbs.fa: Mark Hadnot, Jim Reynolds, Lance Bateman, 1989

content.description: Fun climbing up a steep wall on consistently overhanging limestone. Great summertime climbing as the route is out of the sun. Helmets highly recommended on every route on this wall.
content.protection: Quickdraws. No more than 12 needed. Memory tells me it is no more than six-seven bolts with chain anchors.
content.location: This is on the northwesternish side of the cosmic web wall. You will immediately identify this face by its dark gray/blackish colored limestone. The rock is steep, consistently overhanging with good holds. This is the left most line of bolts.
